meanings.definition: To crush or grind into fine particles
meanings.sent1: She was triturating the spices in the mortar and pestle.
meanings.sent2: The chef was triturating the garlic to make a flavorful paste.
meanings.sent3: The noisy blender was triturating the ice cubes for the refreshing smoothie.
meanings.sent4: The heavy machinery was triturating the rocks into gravel for construction.
meanings.sent5: The millstone was triturating the wheat into flour with a rhythmic sound.

meanings.definition: The act of pulverizing or grinding into a powder
meanings.sent1: The trituration process turned the seeds into a fine powder.
meanings.sent2: The trituration of the herbs resulted in a fragrant mixture.
meanings.sent3: The loud trituration of the machine made the whole room dusty.
meanings.sent4: The trituration of the tablets created a smooth medicinal powder.
meanings.sent5: The trituration of the rocks produced a cloud of fine dust in the air.
